sentences.english: Blame was attached upon Prime Minister Laughton's Cabinet for yielding to the Russians.
sentences.chinese: 勞頓首相的內閣因向俄國人屈服而受到責難。

sentences.english: No reason for disgust, she intones, no cause for condemnation.
sentences.chinese: 她詠吟道，沒必要去厭惡，沒理由去責難。

sentences.english: I would wish not to be hasty in censuring anyone.
sentences.chinese: 我總希望不要輕易責難一個人。

sentences.english: He says his accusers are trying to discredit government foreign-aid policies.
sentences.chinese: 他說他的責難者試圖使政府的對外援助政策名聲掃地。

sentences.english: He wanted to quit himself of any blame for our failure.
sentences.chinese: 對於我們的失敗他不想受到任何責難。

sentences.english: The members censured him since he had done a very contemptible thing.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他做了一件很可鄙的事情，會員們都責難他。

sentences.english: God makes just condemnations of sin and unbelief.
sentences.chinese: 神對罪與悖逆發出公義的責難。

sentences.english: Wall Streeters and the financial experts are also at fault.
sentences.chinese: 華爾街人和金融專家也其責難咎。

sentences.english: Truth may be blamed,but shall never be shamed.
sentences.chinese: 真理可能會被責難，但絕不會受羞辱。

sentences.english: Tears of disappointment and reproach glistened in her blue eyes, but she said nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她藍色的服裏閃爍起失望和責難的淚花，沒有說話。

sentences.english: I could imagine that my old penholder feels reproachfully towards me .
sentences.chinese: 我能夠想象得到，我的老筆桿對我有責難之意。

sentences.english: The piteous moan of reproach was drowned in the angry and menacing roar of the mob.
sentences.chinese: 責難的哀吟，淹沒在人羣雷霆怒吼之中。

sentences.english: Maybe you’re just putting it across in a mundane way.
sentences.chinese: 說不定你只是用一種平庸厭倦的眼光責難它。

sentences.english: We shall not cumber our thought with his reproaches.
sentences.chinese: 我們不要受他責難的影響，思想裹步不前。

sentences.english: But I don't just want to rant at commercial anti-malware companies.
sentences.chinese: 我並非要大聲責難商業反惡意軟件公司。

sentences.english: So will it be for the G-20 conference in London.
sentences.chinese: 因此，倫敦的20國集團會議將會受到責難。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
